Posts.Content: Oct 11, 2015 08:20AM upstater15 wrote: I'm wondering if anyone has had this experience--I am 5 weeks out from LX/SNB (they thought they took 2 nodes, but it was really 4--there was a clump of 3). I've started to notice what looks like an AWS "cord" developing from my affected armpit extending a few inches into my upper arm on the affected side. But it doesn't hurt at all, or feel tight. It's definitely there though. Is this the early stages of AWS? I don't even know which dr to ask...my surgeon is 2.5 hours away at a major cancer center and I'm not scheduled to see him for another 2+ months. My RO and MO are both local...I'm 3 days into radiation, so I guess I can ask my RO on Monday. Thanks for any insight...
Posts.Title: Axillary Web Syndrome (cording) Lojo LovingIsLiving

Posts.Content: upstater15 wrote: Hi all...wondering if anyone has had an experience similar to mine. I had lumpectomy and SNB surgery back in September 2015 (seems like ages ago). Surgery was uneventful, got to skip chemo, and had radiation in Oct/Nov 2015. Now, 8 months after surgery, I went back to my surgeon because I felt a hard painful lump along my lumpectomy scar. I didn't get too worried (although all symptoms are worrisome, now), and was relived to learn that the lump was fluid-filled. The doctor aspirated it and the fluid that came out was blood--a hematoma. The relief was short-lived, as it began to re-form within a few hours. The newest development, though, is that after I showered this morning, blood started leaking out from the hole where it was poked with the needle. It's been bleeding all day (fun!). So my question is whether this has ever happened to anyone this long after surgery, and if so, how long did it take to go away? I'd like to have a sense of when I can stop putting a maxi-pad in my bra! Thanks! Dx 8/7/2015, ILC, Left, 1cm, Stage IA, Grade 2, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Surgery 9/4/2015 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Sentinel Radiation Therapy 10/7/2015 Breast Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Late developing hematoma? upstater15 upstater15

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2015 06:39PM upstater15 wrote: What a relief to find this thread! I'm 9 days post lumpectomy, SNB, and have developed armpit swelling and that bizarre chafing sensation! I have a call scheduled with surgeon tomorrow anyway (pathology results expected, yikes), so was going to ask about it then, but in the meantime, it really helps to know that this is a common symptom and nothing to be worried about. Whew!
